title:
Continuous-space event-driven simulations of reaction-diffusion
  processes in three dimensions
abstract:
We show that reaction-diffusion processes in three dimensions can be
efficiently handled by event-driven numerical simulations, based on statistical
waiting times (Gillespie's Monte-Carlo method). The algorithm is efficient for
dilute systems, since diffusion is not simulated, only the result of diffusion
between events needs to be implemented.
